newsitem.title: IRAQ: Iraq says it uncovers CIA spy network.
newsitem.headline: Iraq says it uncovers CIA spy network.

text.p: Iraq said on Friday that it had uncovered a spy network working for the U.S. Central Intelligence Agency (CIA).
"Iraqi Intelligence has uncovered a spy and sabotage group which works for the American Central Intelligence Agency," the Iraqi News Agency INA said, quoting state-run television.
INA said members of the group have admitted that they carried out spying activities in Iraq.
"Baghdad television said members of the group have confessed their activities against Iraq, its people and its leader President Saddam Hussein," INA said.
The agency said the state-run television and Youth television, owned by Saddam's eldest son Uday, would interview the group at 10.00 p.m. (1900 GMT).
